thread.section_title: Drake drops new album More Life and his ‘Brit rap’ is getting mixed reviews – Metro
thread.title: Drake drops new album More Life and his ‘Brit rap’ is getting mixed reviews
thread.title_full: Drake drops new album More Life and his ‘Brit rap’ is getting mixed reviews

author: Katie Baillie
title: Drake drops new album More Life and his ‘Brit rap’ is getting mixed reviews
text:
Drake finally dropped his new album (Picture: Andrew Benge/Redferns) Drake has followed through on his promise and his new collection of music, More Life, is streaming everywhere.
The Rolling Stones lead celebrity tributes to Chuck Berry, who has died aged 90 The ‘playlist’ as he calls it, rather than album, is now doing the rounds and on the most part people are loving it. But fans can’t help but notice his shift in sound – it appears the rapper may well have been heavily influenced by his travels to the UK.
The album has a distinctly Brit vibe, with the likes of Skepta, Giggs, Sampha and Jorja Smith popping up on some tracks, although he of course still features his pals Kanye West, 2 Chainz and Young Thug.
Not bad going bringing out new music while still touring his last album Views, and on the whole people are absolutely loving it.
But the sound of his new ‘Brit rap’ hasn’t gone down well with everyone.
Drake getting on that Brit rap. Dk what to feel bout that 🤔
— Ritchie (@ritchielhf) March 19, 2017 
We let drake turn into a Brit before our very own eyes. What a time to be alive.
— Jelani (@NevaDyingBroke) March 19, 2017 
sorry but Drake doin a fake cockney accent isn't the one #MoreLife 
— Lily (@lilfieldz) March 19, 2017 
So now Drake is a Brit…I can't with you all 
— Rachaad (@Dre6001) March 19, 2017 
Everyone's talking about #morelife so I'm listening it and it's bloody identical to all the others Drake's songs. Why are you so excited smh
— Giuliana (@juliennelapin) March 19, 2017 
Or is it amazing? Drake's new album is actually great. Probably one of his best
— NUMERO (@ImNumeroUnoBaby) March 19, 2017 
Bout' one minute into @Drake album like pic.twitter.com/rMsP41vimJ 
— Don P. (@whatupson47) March 19, 2017 
Drake blesses us with more greatness #morelife 
— an10nia (@antoniakemi) March 19, 2017 

 
Oh man, the new #drake album is fireeee ❤❤ . Pure gold #drizzy #musicmonday 
— Ismail Mostafa (@isher92) March 19, 2017 
It seems to be a bit of everything. This guy is a bit of a genius. Lmao Drake gave us grime, dancehall, R&B, pop, kwaito, soul. All on one album. Madness.
— overwoke (@Sick_Sage) March 19, 2017 
And there are unexpected upsides to this new music. Thanks to Drake I know have Instagram captions for dayssss
— S O F I E (@sofiesvanikier) March 19, 2017 

Have a listen:

The album was released across several streaming devises, rather than just on Apple Music as was thought.
Drake recently told the crowd of his Leeds gig: ‘I’m excited, ‘cos I’m about a week-and-a-half, two weeks away from finishing this project I’m working on called More Life.
MARCH 18 
A post shared by champagnepapi (@champagnepapi) on Mar 13, 2017 at 4:23pm PDT 
‘So you know what that means, right? All that means is I get to drop a new project, and at some point, I get to be back with my people in Leeds one more time.’
It waits to be seen how he’ll celebrate this one, given that he celebrated one night of his tour with £500 worth of Nandos chicken , and another with £1000 worth of pizza , and over £30k on an after party. 
We think this is a dazzling story and so do you! Like Metro Entertainment on Facebook for more of this on your news feed.
